intro: Trichopyrum varnense, commonly known as the Varnense trichopyrum, is a member of the grass family (Poaceae). It is a perennial herb that typically grows in moist, open habitats such as meadows and wetlands. The plant features slender,丛生 stems and small, narrow leaves that are often hairy. Its inflorescence consists of spikelets that are loosely arranged, and it produces small, wind-pollinated flowers. Trichopyrum varnense is notable for its ecological role in stabilizing soil and supporting local insect populations.
